html: 3.24.25  4:53 am   I've run into a problem: I get both my best ideas and my most intense motivation to work on music when I'm very emotional and excited (positive or negative). But at the same time, working on music is therapeutic and calming for me. So whenever I start working on music because I'm emotional and excited, the act of working on music calms me down, and then I stop having ideas or motivation for whatever I was working on. Do you have any advice for how I could fix or work around that problem?
original_html: 3.24.25  4:53 am   I've run into a problem: I get both my best ideas and my most intense motivation to work on music when I'm very emotional and excited (positive or negative). html:
3.24.25  1:22 am   I've been thinking about happiness lately, what it is and what it means to be happy. I've landed on: happiness is love. Love for other people, the world, music, everything. The more you love, the happier you'll be.
I'm not sure there are very many things in the world worth loving, though. I think I hate a lot of things, and I'm not sure how to start loving or if I'll ever be able to.
Have you ever had similar thoughts?
I'm a big fan of yours and I appreciate what you've shared with the world. Thank you.
